instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message: Hello I checked U9310 all the output voltages are 0V I only get 1.5V on PP3V3_SSD_LIM

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message:
Do you get correct voltages and signals on both sides of J9600?
Check continuity left/right.

What about SSD_PWRCON0 and SSD_PMIC_LDO (U9310).

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message: I solved it by replacing C9301, now I have a problem with the audio it does not emit sound, except that of charging, it does not emit the boot sound and the sound in general, the system detects the internal speakers

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message:
The machine detects the headphones?
Did you try another speakers?

Check RESET* signal of all audio amplifiers.

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message: Now the image is disturbed in this way[ATTACH type="full"]61133[/ATTACH]

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message:
Did you try known good screen?
What about external monitor?

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message: Tried with a new screen and it does the same, it looks like a logic board problem

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question folder
threads.message:
Can you switch between iGPU and dGPU and see if image changes?

"What about external monitor?"
dGPU is enabled then.
